patterns: give me the definition of stock
what is the definition of stock
responses: A stock, or equity, is a financial instrument that reflects ownership of a portion of the corporation. If you own it, you automatically get a share of ownership of that company!

patterns: give me the definition of stock market
what is the definition of stock market
responses: Stock market is a place where investors buy and sell shares of companies. This market allow you to see the shares in each corporation or the overall economy
Investors often purchase and sell company shares on the stock market

patterns: what are the procedure to buy stock
what should i do if i want to buy stock
responses: If you want to buy a stock, you need a broker. Broker acts as an intermediary between investors and aset traders. It is easier if you buy stocks through online stockbrocker. One of must important requirement is you must have required fund to invest.

patterns: give me the definition of trader
what is the definition of trader
responses: In Stock, trader refers to the activity of buying and selling assets

responses: You must be atleast 18-years-old to buy stock
You have to be 18-years-old to buy stocks on your own
If you already reaching 18, you are good to go

patterns: give me the definition of dividend
what is the definition of dividend
responses: Dividends are distribution of payments made to shareholders from a company's profits. The distribution is determined by each company itself.

patterns: what the reason to buy stock
responses: You can get greater return
You can protect your finances, particularly against inflation.

patterns: is it too late to buy stock
can i buy stock right now
responses: It is never to late to invest. If you never buy any stock before, you can start by doing some research about stock market such as what to do, what to avoid, risk, benefit and others. The faster you start, the more benefit you can get.

in analyzing stock, you definitely want fast and accurate result. There are several Stock analysis and research tool you can use but if you do not want to spend any cent, try Yahoo Finance, Zacks, and Google Finance for starter

patterns: give me the definition of market capitalization
what is the definition of market capitalization
responses: Market Capitalization is the aggregate market value of a company. In another sense, it is the total value of the company's shares that are publicly traded in a larger stock market. Which means it can evaluate how worth company's stock share in market.

patterns: give me the definition of market cap
what is the definition of market cap
responses: Market Cap is the aggregate market value of a company. In another sense, it is the total value of the company's shares that are publicly traded in a larger stock market. Which means it can evaluate how worth company's stock share in market.

patterns: give me the definition of pbv
what is the definition of pbv
responses: PBV or Price to book value is ration to comparing stock price company to book value per share. It can be used to assess whether the stock is categorized as overvalued (expensive) or undervalued (cheap)

patterns: what is price to book value
give me the definition of price to book value
what is the definition of price to book value
what price to book value means
responses: PBV or Price to book value is ration to comparing stock price company to book value per share. It can be used to assess whether the stock is categorized as overvalued (expensive) or undervalued (cheap)

patterns: give me the definition of book value
what is the definition of book value
responses: Book value per share defined as its total assets minus any liabilities. It measures a company's net worth.

patterns: give me the definition of p/e
what is the definition of p/e
responses: Price earning ratio is one of the financial ratios used to see how the potential of the profit in a company. It calculated by dividing the market value price per share by the company's earnings per share.

patterns: give me the definition of price earning ratio
what is the definition of price earning ratio
responses: Price earning ratio is one of the financial ratios used to see how the potential of the profit in a company. It calculated by dividing the market value price per share by the company's earnings per share.

patterns: give me the definition of peg
what is the definition of peg
responses: Price/Earning-to-Growth (PEG) Ratio is a ratio used to predict the company's earnings growth in the future. The PEG ratio compares a company P/E ratio to its expected rate of growth

patterns: what is price earning to growth
give me the definition of price earning to growth
what is the definition of price earning to growth
what price earning to growth means
responses: Price/Earning-to-Growth (Price Earning to Growth) Ratio is a ratio used to predict the company's earnings growth in the future. The Price Earning to Growth ratio compares a company P/E ratio to its expected rate of growth

patterns: give me the definition of eps
what is the definition of eps
responses: Earnings Per Share or EPS can be defined as financial ratio of the amount of net income in each share. It indicates how much money a company makes for each share of its stock.

patterns: give me the definition of earnings per share
what is the definition of earnings per share
responses: EPS or Earnings Per Share can be defined as financial ratio of the amount of net income in each share. It indicates how much money a company makes for each share of its stock.

patterns: give me the definition of profit margin
what is the definition of profit margin
responses: Profit margin is the ratio of profitability that represent the precentage of sales that turn into profit. It ususally really depend on the net income of the company.

patterns: give me the definition of dividend yield
what is the definition of dividend yield
responses: Dividend yield is a financial ratio that used to measure the rate of dividend return to shareholder or investors. For example, if a company has a $20 share price and pays a dividend of $1 per year, its dividend yield would be 5%

patterns: give me the definition of beta
what is the definition of beta
responses: A Beta in Stock measures the stock volatility compared with the overall market. In another word, beta is an indicator to measure the sensitivity of a stock to the overall market movement. It's good to showing the risk of the stock to the stock market

patterns: give me the definition of volatility
what is the definition of volatility
responses: Volatility is the frequency of movement between rising or falling stock prices. It may be affected by natural disasters, economic and political factors, company performance, or industry and sector factors.

patterns: give me the definition of 52 week high
what is the definition of 52 week high
responses: Indicators that are usually used by investors and sellers in analyzing stocks. It explained the range of stock prices from lowest to highest during the previous year (52 Weeks). 52-week high means the highest stock price can reach or traded during that period (in 52 weeks). You can see this price to help you understand the current stocks value in the stock market.

patterns: give me the definition of 52 week low
what is the definition of 52 week low
responses: Indicators that are usually used by investors and sellers in analyzing stocks. It explained the range of stock prices from lowest to highest during the previous year (52 Weeks). 52-week low means the lowest stock price can reach or traded during that period (in 52 weeks). You can use 52 week low to determine stop-loss levels as a way of limiting losses.
